All the day they twist my words; all their thoughts are against me for evil.
They stir up strife, they lie in wait, they mark my steps, as they have hoped to take my life.
Because of their iniquity, let there be no escape for them; in anger bring down the peoples, O God.
You have counted my wanderings; put my tears into your bottle. Are they not in your book?
Then shall my enemies turn back in the day when I call; this I know, that God is for me.
In God I will praise the word; in the LORD I will praise the word.
In God I have trusted; I will not fear. What can man do to me?
Upon me, O God, are your vows; I will render thank offerings to you.
For you have delivered my soul from death; have you not kept my feet from stumbling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living?
For the choirmaster: Do Not Destroy. Of David. A miktam, when he fled from the face of Saul, in the cave.
Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me, for in You my soul takes refuge; and in the shadow of Your wings I will take refuge, until calamities have passed by.
I will cry to God Most High, to God who completes His purpose for me.
He shall send from heaven and save me, He reproaches the one who pants after me. Selah. God shall send forth His mercy and His truth.
My soul is in the midst of lions; I lie down among those who devour, the sons of men whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.
Be exalted above the heavens, O God; let Your glory be over all the earth.
They prepared a net for my steps; my soul was bowed down. They dug a pit before me; they have fallen into its midst. Selah.
Steadfast is my heart, O God, steadfast is my heart; I will sing and make melody.
Awake, my glory; awake, harp and lyre; I will awaken the dawn.
I will praise You, O Lord, among the peoples; I will sing to You among the nations.
For great is Your mercy to the heavens, and Your truth to the skies.
Be exalted above the heavens, O God; let Your glory be over all the earth.
For the choirmaster: Do Not Destroy. Of David. A miktam.
Do you indeed speak righteousness in silence? Do you judge uprightly, O sons of man?
Yes, in heart you work out iniquities; in the earth you weigh out the violence of your hands.
The wicked are estranged from the womb; they go astray from the belly, speaking lies.
Their venom is like the venom of a serpent, like a deaf viper that stops its ear.
Which does not listen to the voice of charmers, or of the skillful enchanter binding spells.
O God, break their teeth in their mouth; tear out the fangs of the young lions, O LORD.
Let them melt away like waters that run continually; when he bends his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as though they are cut off.
Like a snail that melts as it goes, like the miscarriage of a woman that has not seen the sun.
Before your pots can feel the thorns, whether green or burning, he will sweep them away.
The righteous shall rejoice when he beholds vengeance; he shall wash his footsteps in the blood of the wicked.
And man will say, Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely there is a God who judges in the earth.
For the choirmaster: Do Not Destroy. Of David. A miktam, when Saul sent, and they watched the house to put him to death.
Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; set me securely on high from those who rise up against me.
Deliver me from workers of iniquity, and from men of blood save me.
For behold, they lie in wait for my soul; the mighty gather themselves against me, not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.
Without guilt they run and prepare themselves; awake to meet me, and behold.
But you, O LORD God of hosts, God of Israel, awake to punish all the nations; do not be gracious to any treacherous workers of iniquity. Selah.
They return at evening, they snarl like a dog, and go around the city.
Behold, they belch out with their mouths; swords are in their lips, for who, they say, hears?
But you, O LORD, shall laugh at them; you shall hold all the nations in derision.
Because of his strength I will watch for You, for God is my high fortress.
The God of my steadfast love will go before me; God will let me look upon those who lie in wait for me.
Do not slay them, lest my people forget; make them wander by your power, and bring them low, O Lord our shield.
By the sin of their mouth, the word of their lips, let them be caught in their pride; and for cursing and for lying which they speak.
Bring them to an end in wrath, bring them to an end, that they be no more; and let them know that God rules in Jacob, to the ends of the earth. Selah.
They return at evening, they snarl like a dog, and go around the city.
They wander up and down for food; if they are not satisfied, they lodge all night.
But as for me, I will sing of Your strength; I will shout for joy in the morning of Your lovingkindness, for You have been a stronghold to me and a refuge in the day of my distress.
O my strength, to you I will sing praises, for God is my high tower, the God of my steadfast love.
For the choirmaster; according to Shushan Eduth. A miktam of David, for instruction.
When he strove with Aram of the Two Rivers and with Aram Zobah, and Joab returned and struck down Edom in the Valley of Salt, twelve thousand.
O God, You have cast us off, You have broken us; You have been angry—restore us again.
You have made the earth tremble; you have torn it open; heal its breaches, for it is tottering.
You have shown your people hard things; you have made us drink the wine of staggering.
You have given a banner to those who fear you, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
That Your beloved ones may be delivered, save with Your right hand and answer me.
God has spoken in His holiness: I will exult; I will divide Shechem, and measure out the Valley of Succoth.
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is the stronghold of my head; Judah is my lawgiver.
Moab is my washbasin; upon Edom I will cast my sandal; over Philistia, shout in triumph.
Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
Have not you yourself, O God, cast us off, and will you not go forth, O God, with our armies?
Give us help against the adversary, for vain is the salvation of man.
Through God we shall do valiantly, and He it is who will tread down our adversaries.
For the choirmaster; with stringed instruments. Of David.
Hear, O God, my cry of rejoicing; give ear to my prayer.
From the end of the earth I call to You when my heart is faint; lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
For you have been a refuge for me, a strong tower from before the enemy.
Let me sojourn in Your tent forever; let me take refuge in the shelter of Your wings. Selah.
For you, O God, have heard my vows; you have given the heritage of those who fear your name.
You will add days to the days of the king; his years shall be as generation after generation.
He shall abide before God forever; appoint lovingkindness and truth, that they may preserve him.
So will I sing praise to Your name forever, that I may perform my vows day by day.
For the choirmaster; according to Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
Only toward God my soul waits in silence; from Him comes my salvation.
Surely he alone is my rock and my salvation, my high stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.
How long will you rush upon a man, that you may all of you crush him, like a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
Surely they consult only to thrust him down from his high place; they delight in lies; with their mouth they bless, but inwardly they curse. Selah.
Only for God my soul waits in silence, for from Him is my hope.
He only is my rock and my salvation, my high tower; I shall not be shaken.
Upon God rests my salvation and my glory; the rock of my strength, my refuge, is in God.
Trust in Him at all times, O people; pour out your heart before Him; God is a refuge for us. Selah.
Surely a vapor are the sons of Adam, a lie are the sons of man; in the balances they go up, they are altogether lighter than vapor.
Do not trust in oppression, and do not vainly set hope in robbery; if riches increase, do not set your heart upon them.
Once has God spoken; twice have I heard this: that power belongs to God.
And to You, O Lord, belongs lovingkindness, for You repay a man according to his work.
A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
O God, you are my God; early will I seek you. My soul thirsts for you, my flesh longs for you, in a dry and weary land without water.
So I have looked upon you in the sanctuary, to behold your power and your glory.
Because your lovingkindness is better than life, my lips shall praise you.
So will I bless you while I live; in your name I will lift up my hands.
My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness, and my mouth shall praise You with lips of joyful song.
When I remember You upon my bed, in the night watches I meditate on You.
For you have been my help, and in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.
My soul clings after You; Your right hand upholds me.
But those who seek my life to ruin it shall go into the lowest parts of the earth.
They shall be poured out by the hand of the sword; they shall be a portion for jackals.
But the king shall rejoice in God; everyone who swears by Him shall glory, for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.
For the choirmaster. A psalm of David.
Hear, O God, my voice in my complaint; from the dread of the enemy preserve my life.
Hide me from the secret counsel of evildoers, from the tumult of the workers of iniquity.
Who have sharpened their tongue like a sword, and have aimed their arrows, even bitter words.
To shoot in secret at the blameless; suddenly they shoot at him and do not fear.
They strengthen themselves in an evil matter; they talk of laying secret snares; they say, Who shall see them?
They search out iniquities; we have perfected a diligent search. And the inward part of man and the heart are deep.
But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall their wounds be.
They shall make their own tongue stumble upon themselves; all who see them shall shake their heads.
And all mankind shall fear, and shall declare the work of God, and wisely consider what He has done.
The righteous shall rejoice in the LORD and take refuge in Him, and all the upright in heart shall glory.
For the choirmaster. A psalm of David. A song.
To you belongs silence as praise, O God, in Zion, and to you shall the vow be fulfilled.
O You who hear prayer, to You all flesh shall come.
Words of iniquities prevail against me; as for our transgressions, you shall cover them.
Blessed is the one whom You choose and bring near, that he may dwell in Your courts; we shall be satisfied with the goodness of Your house, the holiness of Your temple.
With awesome deeds in righteousness you answer us, O God of our salvation, the confidence of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest sea.
Who establishes the mountains by His power, being girded with might.
Who stills the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples.
Those who dwell in the ends of the earth fear at Your signs; You make the outgoings of morning and evening to shout for joy.
You visit the earth and water it, you greatly enrich it; the river of God is full of water. You prepare their grain, for so you prepare it.
You water its furrows abundantly, you settle its ridges; with showers you soften it, you bless its growth.
You crown the year with Your goodness, and Your paths drip with abundance.
The pastures of the wilderness drip, and the hills gird themselves with rejoicing.
The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys are wrapped in grain; they shout for joy, they also sing.
Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth.
Sing the glory of His name; set forth the glory of His praise.
Say to God, “How awesome are Your works! Because of the greatness of Your power, Your enemies will cringe before You.”
All the earth shall bow down to You and sing praises to You; they shall sing praises to Your name. Selah.
Come and see the works of God; awesome is His deed toward the children of man.
He turned the sea into dry land; through the river they passed on foot; there we rejoiced in Him.
He rules by His might forever; His eyes keep watch upon the nations. Let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
Bless our God, O peoples, and make the voice of His praise to be heard.
Who has set our soul among the living, and has not given our foot to be moved.
For you have tested us, O God; you have refined us as silver is refined.
You brought us into the net; you laid a crushing burden upon our loins.
You caused mortal man to ride over our head; we went through fire and through water, but you brought us out to abundance.
I will come into Your house with burnt offerings; I will pay to You my vows.
Which my lips have uttered and my mouth has spoken when I was in distress.
Burnt offerings of fatlings I will offer up to you, with the sweet smoke of rams; I will prepare cattle with he-goats. Selah.
Come, hear, all you who fear God, and I will declare what He has done for my soul.
To him I cried with my mouth, and exaltation was under my tongue.
If I had regarded iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not hear.
But surely God has heard; He has given heed to the voice of my prayer.
Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer, nor his steadfast love from me.
For the choirmaster; with stringed instruments. A psalm, a song.
God be gracious to us and bless us; may He cause His face to shine upon us. Selah.
To make known on earth Your way, among all nations Your salvation.
Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you.
Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, for you judge the peoples with uprightness, and you guide the nations upon the earth. Selah.
Let the peoples praise You, O God; let all the peoples praise You.
The earth has yielded her increase; God, our God, shall bless us.
God shall bless us, and all the ends of the earth shall fear Him.
For the choirmaster. Of David. A psalm, a song.
Let God arise, let His enemies be scattered; let those also who hate Him flee before Him.
As smoke is driven away, so You drive them away; as wax melts before the fire, so let the wicked perish from before God.
But the righteous shall be glad; they shall exult before God; yes, they shall rejoice with gladness.
Sing to God, sing praises to His name; lift up a song to Him who rides upon the deserts; by His name Yah, and exult before Him.
Father of the fatherless and defender of widows is God in his holy habitation.
God makes the solitary to dwell in a house; he brings out prisoners into prosperity, but the rebellious dwell in a parched land.
O God, when You went out before Your people, when You marched through the wilderness. Selah.
The earth shook, the heavens also dripped rain at the presence of God; Sinai itself trembled at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
A rain of generosity you poured out, O God; when your inheritance was weary, you yourself established it.
Your living creatures dwelt in it; you prepared in your goodness for the poor, O God.
The Lord gives the word; the women who proclaim the tidings are a great host.
Kings of armies flee, they flee, and she who remains at home divides the spoil.
Though you lie down among the sheepfolds, the wings of a dove are covered with silver, and her pinions with shimmering gold.
When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was snowing on Zalmon.
A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; a mountain of many peaks is the mountain of Bashan.
Why do you leap, you rugged mountains? This is the mountain God has desired for His dwelling; yes, the LORD will dwell there forever.
The chariots of God are myriads upon myriads, thousands upon thousands; the Lord is among them, Sinai in the sanctuary.
You ascended on high, you led captivity captive; you received gifts among men, even among the rebellious, that the LORD God might dwell there.
Blessed be the Lord; day by day he bears our burden, the God of our salvation. Selah.
God is to us a God of salvations, and to the Lord GOD belong the goings forth of death.
Surely God will crush the head of his enemies, the hairy crown of him who walks in his guilt.
The Lord said, “From Bashan I will bring them back; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea.”
That your foot may be dipped in blood, the tongue of your dogs from the enemies, from them.
They have seen Your goings, O God, the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
Bless God in the great congregation, the Lord, you who are from the fountain of Israel.
In the congregations bless God, the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
There is Benjamin, the youngest, ruling them, the princes of Judah in their throng, the princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.
Your God has commanded your strength; strengthen, O God, that which you have wrought for us.
Because of your temple at Jerusalem, kings shall bring gifts to you.
Rebuke the beast of the reeds, the assembly of the mighty, with the calves of the peoples, trampling underfoot for bars of silver; scatter the peoples who delight in wars.
Nobles shall come out of Egypt; Cush shall hasten to stretch out her hands to God.
O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God; sing praises to the Lord.
To Him who rides upon the ancient highest heavens; behold, He gives forth His voice, a voice of might.
Ascribe strength to God; his majesty is over Israel, and his power is in the skies.
Awesome is God from your sanctuaries; the God of Israel is he who gives strength and might to the people. Blessed be God.
For the choirmaster; according to “Lilies.” Of David.
Save me, O God, for the waters have come in to my soul.
I have sunk in deep mire, where there is no standing; I have come into the depths of waters, and the flood overwhelms me.
I am weary with my crying; my throat is parched; my eyes fail while I wait for my God.
More than the hairs of my head are those who hate me without cause; mighty are those who would destroy me, my lying enemies. That which I did not steal, then must I restore.
O God, you yourself know my foolishness, and my guilt is not hidden from you.
Let those who wait for You not be put to shame because of me, O Lord GOD of hosts; let those who seek You not be disgraced because of me, O God of Israel.
For your sake I have borne reproach; shame has covered my face.
I have become a stranger to my brothers, and an alien to my mother’s children.
For zeal for Your house has consumed me, and the reproaches of those who reproach You have fallen upon me.
When I wept and afflicted my soul with fasting, it became a reproach to me.
I made sackcloth my garment, and I became a byword to them.
Those who sit in the gate speak against me, and I am the song of the drunkards.
But as for me, my prayer is to You, O LORD, in an acceptable time; O God, in the greatness of Your lovingkindness answer me, in the truth of Your salvation.
Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink; let me be delivered from those who hate me, and out of the deep waters.
Do not let the flood of waters sweep me away, nor let the deep swallow me up, and do not let the pit shut its mouth over me.
Answer me, O LORD, for your lovingkindness is good; according to the greatness of your mercies, turn to me.
And do not hide Your face from Your servant, for I am in distress; make haste, answer me.
Draw near to my soul and redeem it; because of my enemies, ransom me.
You know my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonor; all my adversaries are before You.
Reproach has broken my heart, and I am sick; I looked for one to show pity, but there was none, and for comforters, but I found none.
They also gave me gall for my food, and for my thirst they made me drink vinegar.
Let their table before them become a snare, and for their well-being a trap.
Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and make their loins continually to shake.
Pour out Your indignation upon them, and let the fierceness of Your anger overtake them.
Let their encampment be desolate; in their tents let there be none to dwell.
For you, whom you have struck, they pursue; and of the pain of your wounded they recount.
Add iniquity to their iniquity, and let them not come into Your righteousness.
Let them be blotted out of the book of life, and let them not be written with the righteous.
But as for me, I am afflicted and in pain; O God, may Your salvation set me securely on high.
I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify Him with thanksgiving.
And it shall please the LORD better than an ox, than a bull with horns and hoofs.
The humble have seen it and rejoice; you who seek God, let your heart live.
For the LORD hears the needy, and does not despise his prisoners.
Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas, and all that moves in them.
For God will save Zion and will build the cities of Judah, and they shall dwell there and possess it.
And the seed of His servants shall inherit it, and those who love His name shall dwell in it.
For the choirmaster. Of David, for remembrance.
O God, to deliver me; O LORD, make haste to help me.
Let those who seek my life be put to shame and confounded; let those who desire my hurt be turned back and disgraced.
Let them turn back because of their shame, who say, “Aha, aha.”
Let all those who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; and let those who love Your salvation say continually, “Let God be magnified.”
But as for me, I am poor and needy; O God, make haste to me. You are my help and my deliverer; O LORD, do not delay.
In you, O LORD, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame.
In Your righteousness deliver me and rescue me; incline Your ear to me and save me.
Be to me a rock of habitation, to which I may continually come; you have commanded to save me, for you are my rock and my stronghold.
My God, deliver me from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of the unjust and the ruthless.
For you are my hope, O Lord GOD, my trust from my youth.
Upon you I have been upheld from the womb; from my mother’s inward parts you are the one who drew me forth; in you is my praise continually.
I have been as a wonder to many, but you are my strong refuge.
Let my mouth be filled with your praise, all the day with your glory.
Do not cast me off in the time of old age; when my strength fails, do not forsake me.
For my enemies speak against me, and those who watch for my life take counsel together.
They say, “God has forsaken him; pursue and seize him, for there is none to deliver.”
O God, be not far from me; O my God, make haste to help me.
Let those who are adversaries of my soul be put to shame and consumed; let those who seek my hurt be clothed with reproach and dishonor.
But as for me, I will hope continually, and I will yet add to all Your praise.
My mouth shall recount Your righteousness all the day, Your salvation, for I know not how to number them.
I will come in the mighty deeds of the Lord GOD; I will make mention of Your righteousness, Yours alone.
O God, You have taught me from my youth, and until now I declare Your wondrous works.
And even to old age and gray hairs, O God, do not forsake me, until I declare Your mighty arm to a generation, Your power to all who are to come.
And Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heights, You who have done great things; O God, who is like You?
You who have shown me many and grievous troubles, you will revive me again, and from the depths of the earth you will again bring me up.
You will increase my greatness and surround and comfort me.
I also will praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, O my God; I will sing to you with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.
My lips shall shout for joy when I sing praise to You, and my soul, which You have redeemed.
My tongue also shall utter Your righteousness all the day, for they are ashamed, for they are confounded, who seek my hurt.
Of Solomon. O God, give Your judgments to the king, and Your righteousness to the son of the king.
He shall judge Your people with righteousness, and Your poor with justice.
The mountains shall bear peace for the people, and the hills, in righteousness.
He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall crush the oppressor.
They shall fear you as long as the sun endures, and before the moon, throughout all generations.
He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass, like showers that water the earth.
In his days the righteous shall flourish, and abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.
And may he have dominion from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth.
Before him shall the desert tribes bow down, and his enemies shall lick the dust.
The kings of Tarshish and of the coastlands shall render tribute; the kings of Sheba and Seba shall bring an offering.
All kings shall bow down before him; all nations shall serve him.
For he will deliver the needy when he cries, the poor also, and him that has no helper.
He shall have compassion on the poor and needy, and the souls of the needy he shall save.
From oppression and from violence he will redeem their soul, and their blood shall be precious in his eyes.
And he shall live, and one shall give to him of the gold of Sheba; and prayer shall be made for him continually; all the day long they shall bless him.
May there be abundance of grain in the land upon the tops of the mountains; may its fruit rustle like Lebanon, and may they blossom from the city like the grass of the earth.
May his name be forever; before the sun may his name increase, and in him let all nations be blessed; they shall call him happy.
Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who alone does wondrous works.
And blessed be his glorious name forever, and let all the earth be filled with his glory. Amen and Amen.
The prayers of David son of Jesse are ended.
A psalm of Asaph. Surely God is good to Israel, to the pure in heart.
But as for me, my feet had almost slipped; my steps had nearly stumbled.
For I was envious of the arrogant, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
For there are no pangs in their death, and their body is fat and sound.
They are not in the trouble of mortal man, neither are they stricken like other men.
Therefore pride is their necklace; violence covers them as a garment.
Their eyes bulge from fatness; the imaginations of their heart overflow.
They scoff and speak in wickedness of oppression; from on high they speak.
They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walks through the earth.
Therefore his people return here, and waters of abundance are drained out by them.
And they say, How does God know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?
Behold, these are the wicked; and, at ease forever, they have increased in wealth.
Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart and washed my hands in innocence.
For all the day long I am plagued, and my chastening comes every morning.
If I had said, “I will speak thus,” behold, I would have betrayed the generation of Your children.
And when I thought to understand this, it was trouble in my eyes.
until I came into the sanctuaries of God; then I discerned their end.
Surely on slippery places you set them; you cast them down to ruins.
How are they brought to desolation in a moment! They are utterly consumed with terrors.
Like a dream when one awakes, O Lord, when You rouse Yourself, You will despise their image.
For my heart was grieved, and my inward parts were pierced with bitterness.
But I was brutish and did not understand; I was as a beast before You.
Yet I am always with You; You have taken hold of my right hand.
With Your counsel You will guide me, and afterward You will receive me to glory.
Whom have I in heaven but you? And besides you I desire nothing on earth.
My flesh and my heart fail; God is the rock of my heart and my portion forever.
For behold, those who are far from you shall perish; you have destroyed all who are unfaithful to you.
But as for me, the nearness of God is my good; I have made the Lord GOD my refuge, that I may declare all Your works.
A contemplation of Asaph. O God, why have You cast us off forever? Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?
Remember Your congregation, which You purchased of old, the tribe of Your inheritance You redeemed, Mount Zion, wherein You have dwelt.
Lift up your steps to the perpetual ruins; all that the enemy has done evil in the sanctuary.
Your adversaries have roared in the midst of your appointed meeting place; they have set up their signs as signs.
He is known as one who lifts up axes on high in the thick of the forest.
And now its carved work together they break down with hatchet and with hammers.
They have cast fire into your sanctuary; they have profaned the dwelling place of your name to the ground.
They said in their heart, Let us destroy them altogether; they have burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
Our signs we do not see; there is no longer any prophet, and none among us knows how long.
How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy despise Your name forever?
Why do you hold back your hand, even your right hand? From within your bosom draw it out and consume.
Yet God is my King from of old, working salvations in the midst of the earth.
You divided the sea by Your strength; You broke the heads of the sea monsters upon the waters.
You crushed the heads of Leviathan; you gave him as food to the people of the wilderness.
You split open spring and torrent; you dried up ever-flowing rivers.
Yours is the day, yours also the night; you have prepared the light and the sun.
You have set all the boundaries of the earth; summer and winter, you formed them.
Remember this: the enemy has reproached, O LORD, and a foolish people have blasphemed Your name.
Do not give over the soul of your turtledove to the wild beast; do not forget the life of your afflicted ones forever.
Look upon the covenant, for the dark places of the earth are full of haunts of violence.
Let not the crushed one return ashamed; let the poor and needy praise Your name.
Arise, O God, plead Your own cause; remember the reproach of the foolish man all the day.
Do not forget the voice of Your adversaries; the tumult of those who rise up against You ascends continually.
For the choirmaster: Do Not Destroy. A psalm of Asaph, a song.
We give thanks to you, O God, we give thanks, for your name is near; they recount your wondrous works.
For when I take the appointed time, I myself will judge with uprightness.
The earth and all its inhabitants are dissolving; I myself steady its pillars. Selah.
I said to the boastful, Do not boast; and to the wicked, Do not lift up the horn.
Do not lift up your horn on high; do not speak with an insolent neck.
For not from the east, nor from the west, nor yet from the wilderness comes lifting up.
For God is the judge; this one He brings low, and that one He lifts up.
For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, and the wine is foaming, full of mixture; and he pours out from it, surely its dregs they shall drain and drink, all the wicked of the earth.
But as for me, I will declare forever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
And all the horns of the wicked I will cut off, but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
For the choirmaster, with stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph, a song.
God is made known in Judah; in Israel great is His name.
And His tabernacle was in Salem, and His dwelling place in Zion.
There He broke the flaming arrows of the bow, the shield and the sword and the battle. Selah.
You are resplendent, more majestic than the mountains of prey.
The stouthearted were plundered; they sank into their sleep, and all the men of might could not find their hands.
At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both chariot and horse fell into a deep sleep.
You, even You, are to be feared; and who can stand before You when once Your anger is aroused?
From heaven you made judgment heard; the earth feared and was still.
When God arose to judgment, to save all the humble of the earth. Selah.
For the wrath of man shall praise You; with the remainder of wrath You will gird Yourself.
Vow and pay to the LORD your God; let all who are around Him bring tribute to the One to be feared.
He restrains the spirit of princes; He is awesome to the kings of the earth.
For the choirmaster; according to Jeduthun. Of Asaph, a psalm.
My voice is to God, and I cry; my voice is to God, and he gives ear to me.
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord; my hand was stretched out in the night and did not grow weary; my soul refused to be comforted.
I remember God, and I moan; I meditate, and my spirit grows faint. Selah.
You have held my eyelids open; I am troubled and cannot speak.
I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.
I remember my song in the night; I commune with my own heart, and my spirit makes diligent search.
Will the Lord cast off forever, and will He never again be favorable?
Has his lovingkindness ceased forever? Has his promise come to an end for all generations?
Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has He in anger shut up His compassions? Selah.
Then I said, “This is my grief: that the years of the right hand of the Most High have changed.”
I will remember the deeds of the LORD; surely I will remember Your wonders of old.
I will meditate on all Your work, and muse on Your mighty deeds.
O God, your way is in holiness; who is a great god like our God?
You are the God who works wonders; you have made known among the peoples your mighty power.
With an outstretched arm you redeemed your people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
The waters saw You, O God, the waters saw You, they trembled; indeed, the depths were shaken.
The clouds poured out water; the skies gave forth a sound; your arrows also went to and fro.
The voice of Your thunder was in the whirlwind; the lightnings lit up the world; the earth trembled and shook.
Your way was in the sea, and your path in the great waters, and your footsteps were not known.
You led Your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
A contemplation of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, to my teaching; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
I will open my mouth in a parable; I will utter dark sayings of old.
Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have recounted to us.
We will not hide them from their children, telling to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and His might, and His wondrous works that He has done.
And He established a testimony in Jacob, and set a law in Israel, which He commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children.
That the generation to come might know, even the children who shall be born; that they may arise and declare them to their children.
That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep His commandments.
And that they should not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that did not set its heart aright, and whose spirit was not faithful to God.
The sons of Ephraim, armed and drawing the bow, turned back in the day of battle.
They did not keep the covenant of God, and they refused to walk in His law.
They forgot His deeds, and His wonders that He had shown them.
In the sight of their fathers he wrought wonders, in the land of Egypt, the field of Zoan.
He split the sea and made them pass through, and he set the waters up like a heap.
And he led them with a cloud by day, and all the night with a light of fire.
He split rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink as from the great depths.
He brought forth streams from the rock, and made waters come down like rivers.
And they sinned yet more against Him, rebelling against the Most High in the desert.
And they tested God in their heart, asking food for their craving.
And they spoke against God; they said, Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
Behold, he struck the rock and waters gushed out, and streams overflowed; can he also give bread, or will he prepare meat for his people?
Therefore the LORD heard and was wroth; and a fire was kindled against Jacob, and also anger rose up against Israel.
Because they did not believe in God, and did not trust in His salvation.
Yet he commanded the skies above, and opened the doors of heaven.
And He rained down manna upon them to eat, and gave them the grain of heaven.
Man ate the bread of the mighty; he sent them provision to the full.
He caused the east wind to set forth in the heavens, and by His power He guided the south wind.
He rained down upon them flesh like dust, and winged birds like the sand of the seas.
And he made it fall in the midst of their camp, all around their dwellings.
So they ate and were well filled, and he brought to them what they craved.
They were not estranged from their craving; the food was still in their mouths.
And the anger of God rose against them, and He slew the fattest of them, and struck down the young men of Israel.
In spite of all this they still sinned, and did not believe in His wondrous works.
So He consumed their days in vanity, and their years in sudden terror.
When He slew them, then they sought Him; and they turned back and earnestly sought God.
And they remembered that God was their rock, and the Most High God their Redeemer.
But they flattered Him with their mouth, and with their tongue they lied to Him.
For their heart was not steadfast with Him, and they were not faithful in His covenant.
But He, being compassionate, forgave iniquity and did not destroy; and many times He turned back His anger, and did not stir up all His wrath.
And He remembered that they were flesh, a wind that passes and does not return.
How often they rebelled against Him in the wilderness, and grieved Him in the desert.
And they turned back and tested God, and set limits to the Holy One of Israel.
They did not remember His hand, the day when He redeemed them from the adversary.
When he set his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan.
And he turned their rivers into blood, and their flowing streams they could not drink.
He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them, and frogs, which destroyed them.
He gave their produce to the devouring locust, and their labor to the swarming locust.
He killed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with frost.
He gave over their cattle also to the hail, and their herds to fiery bolts.
He sent among them the fierceness of His anger, wrath and indignation and distress, a delegation of messengers of evil.
He leveled a path for His anger; He did not spare their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence.
And he struck all the firstborn in Egypt, the firstfruits of strength in the tents of Ham.
Then He led forth His people like sheep, and guided them like a flock in the wilderness.
And he led them safely, so that they did not fear; and the sea covered their enemies.
And He brought them to the border of His sanctuary, this mountain which His right hand had acquired.
He drove out the nations before them and apportioned them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.
Yet they tested and rebelled against God Most High, and did not keep His testimonies.
But they turned back and acted treacherously like their fathers; they were twisted like a deceitful bow.
And they provoked Him to anger with their high places, and with their carved images they moved Him to jealousy.
God heard and was enraged, and He utterly rejected Israel.
So He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent where He caused His dwelling among mankind.
And he delivered his strength to captivity, and his glory into the hand of the adversary.
He gave His people over to the sword, and was enraged with His inheritance.
His young men the fire consumed, and his maidens were not given in marriage.
His priests fell by the sword, and his widows made no lament.
Then the Lord awoke as one out of sleep, like a mighty man shouting because of wine.
And He struck His adversaries backward; He put upon them everlasting reproach.
And he rejected the tent of Joseph, and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.
But He chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion which He loved.
And He built His sanctuary like the heights, like the earth which He has founded forever.
And He chose David His servant, and took him from the sheepfolds.
From following the ewes that give suck he brought him, to shepherd Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart, and guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.
A psalm of Asaph. O God, nations have come into Your inheritance; they have defiled Your holy temple, they have laid Jerusalem in ruins.
They have given the corpses of Your servants as food to the birds of the heavens, the flesh of Your faithful ones to the beasts of the earth.
They have poured out their blood like water round about Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.
We have become a reproach to our neighbors, a scorn and derision to those around us.
How long, O LORD, will you be angry forever? Will your jealousy burn like fire?
Pour out Your wrath upon the nations that have not known You, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon Your name.
For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his habitation.
Do not remember against us former iniquities; let Your compassions come quickly to meet us, for we are brought very low.
Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of Your name; and deliver us, and atone for our sins, for Your name’s sake.
Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Let the avenging of the blood of Your servants which is shed be made known among the nations in our sight.
Let the groaning of the prisoner come before You; according to the greatness of Your arm preserve those appointed to death.
And render to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom their reproach with which they have reproached You, O Lord.
But we, Your people and the sheep of Your pasture, will give You thanks forever; from generation to generation we will recount Your praise.
For the choirmaster; set to “Lilies.” A testimony of Asaph, a psalm.
Shepherd of Israel, give ear; You who lead Joseph like a flock, You who sit enthroned upon the cherubim, shine forth.
Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up Your might, and come to save us.
O God, restore us, and cause Your face to shine, that we may be saved.
O LORD God of hosts, how long will you be angry with the prayer of your people?
You have fed them the bread of tears, and given them tears in great measure to drink.
You make us a source of strife to our neighbors, and our enemies mock among themselves.
O God of hosts, restore us, and cause Your face to shine, that we may be saved.
A vine out of Egypt you brought; you drove out the nations and planted it.
You cleared the ground before it, and it took root and filled the land.
The mountains were covered with its shade, and its branches with the mighty cedars of God.
She sent out her branches to the sea, and her shoots to the River.
Why have you broken down her hedges, so that all who pass along the way pluck her?
The boar from the forest ravages it, and the wild beasts of the field feed on it.
O God of hosts, return, I pray; look down from heaven and see, and visit this vine.
And the stock which Your right hand has planted, and the son whom You made strong for Yourself.
It is burned with fire, it is cut down; they perish at the rebuke of Your countenance.
Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand, upon the son of man whom You have made strong for Yourself.
Then we will not turn back from You; give us life, and we will call upon Your name.
O LORD God of hosts, restore us; cause Your face to shine, and we shall be saved.
For the choirmaster; according to the Gittith. Of Asaph.
Sing aloud to God our strength; shout for joy to the God of Jacob.
Lift up a song, and strike the tambourine, the sweet-sounding lyre with the harp.
Blow the trumpet at the new moon, at the full moon, on our feast day.
For it is a statute for Israel, a judgment of the God of Jacob.
He appointed it in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out over the land of Egypt; a language I did not know I heard.
I removed his shoulder from the burden; his hands passed away from the basket.
In distress you called, and I rescued you; I answered you in the secret place of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
Hear, O my people, and I will testify against you; O Israel, if you would but listen to me.
There shall be no strange god among you, nor shall you bow yourself down to a foreign god.
I am the LORD your God, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt; open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.
But my people would not listen to my voice, and Israel would not consent to me.
So I let them go in the stubbornness of their heart; they walked in their own counsels.
Oh that my people would listen to Me, that Israel would walk in My ways.
In a little while I would subdue their enemies, and turn my hand against their adversaries.
Those who hate the LORD would cringe before Him, and their time would endure forever.
And I would feed him with the finest of wheat, and with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.
A psalm of Asaph. God stands in the congregation of God; in the midst of the gods He judges.
How long will you judge unjustly, and lift up the face of the wicked? Selah.
Give justice to the poor and the fatherless; vindicate the afflicted and the needy.
Rescue the poor and needy; deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
They know not, neither do they understand; they walk about in darkness; all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
I said, “You are gods, and all of you are sons of the Most High.”
Nevertheless, like man you shall die, and like one of the princes you shall fall.
Arise, O God, judge the earth, for you shall inherit all the nations.
A song, a psalm of Asaph.
O God, do not keep silent; do not hold Your peace, and do not be still, O God.
For behold, Your enemies roar, and those who hate You have lifted up the head.
Against Your people they devise crafty counsel, and conspire together against Your treasured ones.
They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation, that the name of Israel may be remembered no more.
For with one heart they have taken counsel together; against you they cut a covenant.
The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,
Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre.
Assyria also is joined with them; they have become an arm to the children of Lot. Selah.
Do to them as to Midian, as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the river Kishon.
They were destroyed at En-dor; they became as dung for the ground.
Make their nobles like Oreb and like Zeeb, and all their princes like Zebah and like Zalmunna.
Who said, Let us take to ourselves in possession the pastures of God.
O my God, make them like a whirling wheel, like chaff before the wind.
As fire burns a forest, and as a flame sets the mountains ablaze.
So pursue them with your storm, and terrify them with your tempest.
Fill their faces with shame, that they may seek Your name, O LORD.
Let them be ashamed and dismayed forever; yes, let them be confounded and perish.
And let them know that you, whose name is the LORD, you alone are the Most High over all the earth.
For the choirmaster; on the Gittith. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.
How beloved are your dwelling places, O LORD of hosts.
My soul longs, yes, faints for the courts of the LORD; my heart and my flesh sing for joy to the living God.
Even the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young—Your altars, O LORD of hosts, my King and my God.
Blessed are those who dwell in Your house; they will yet be praising You. Selah.
Blessed is the man whose strength is in you, in whose heart are the highways.
Passing through the valley of Baca, they make it a place of springs; the early rain also wraps it in blessings.
They go from strength to strength; each one appears before God in Zion.
O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob.
Behold, O God, our shield, and look upon the face of Your anointed.
For a day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere; I would choose to stand at the threshold in the house of my God rather than dwell in the tents of wickedness.
For the LORD God is a sun and shield; the LORD will give grace and glory; no good thing will He withhold from those who walk in integrity.
O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man who trusts in You.
For the choirmaster. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.
You have forgiven the iniquity of Your people; You have covered all their sin.
You have taken away the iniquity of Your people; You have covered all their sin. Selah.
You have withdrawn all Your wrath; You have turned back from the fierceness of Your anger.
Turn us again, O God of our salvation, and put away your indignation toward us.
Will you be angry with us forever? Will you draw out your wrath to all generations?
Will you not again revive us, that your people may rejoice in you?
Show us your mercy, O LORD, and grant us your salvation.
I will hear what God the LORD will speak, for He will speak peace to His people and to His faithful ones; but let them not turn again to folly.
Surely his salvation is near to those who fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.
Mercy and truth have met together; righteousness and peace have kissed.
Truth shall spring up from the earth, and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
Yes, the LORD will give what is good, and our land will yield its increase.
Righteousness shall go before him, and shall make his footsteps a way.
A prayer of David. Incline Your ear, O LORD, answer me, for I am poor and needy.
Guard my soul, for I am devoted; save Your servant, for I am Yours, O my God, who trusts in You.
Be gracious to me, O Lord, for to you I cry all the day.
Gladden the soul of Your servant, for to You, my Lord, do I lift up my soul.
For you, Lord, are good and forgiving, and abundant in lovingkindness to all who call upon you.
Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer, and attend to the voice of my supplications.
In the day of my trouble I call upon You, for You answer me.
There is none like You among the gods, O Lord, and there are no works like Yours.
All the nations that you have made shall come and bow down before you, O Lord, and shall glorify your name.
For you are great and work wonders; you alone are God.
Teach me your way, O LORD; I will walk in your truth. Unite my heart to fear your name.
I will praise You, O Lord my God, with all my heart, and I will glorify Your name forever.
For great is Your mercy toward me, and You have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
O God, the proud have risen up against me, and a company of ruthless men have sought my life; and they have not set You before them.
But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abundant in steadfast love and truth.
Turn toward me and be gracious to me; give Your strength to Your servant, and save the son of Your maidservant.
Show me a sign for good, that those who hate me may see and be ashamed, because you, O Lord, have helped me and comforted me.
His foundation is in the holy mountains.
The LORD loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
Glorious things are spoken of you, O city of God. Selah.
I will mention Rahab and Babylon among those who know Me; behold, Philistia and Tyre, with Cush: this one was born there.
And of Zion it shall be said, “This man and that man were born in her,” and the Most High himself shall establish her.
The LORD will count, when He writes up the peoples, “This one was born there.” Selah.
Both singers and players on instruments shall say, All my springs are in you.
A song, a psalm of the sons of Korah, for the choirmaster; according to Mahalath Leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
O LORD, God of my salvation, by day I cry out, in the night before You.
Let my prayer come before You; incline Your ear to my cry.
For my soul is sated with troubles, and my life has drawn near to Sheol.
I am counted with those who go down to the pit; I am as a man without strength.
Set among the dead, free as one slain lying in the grave, whom You remember no more, and they are cut off from Your hand.
You have laid me in the lowest pit, in dark places, in the depths.
Your wrath lies hard upon me, and all your waves you have afflicted me. Selah.
You have put my acquaintances far from me; you have made me an abomination to them. I am shut in and cannot go out.
My eye wastes away because of affliction; I have called upon You, O LORD, every day; I have spread out my hands to You.
Will You work wonders for the dead? Shall the shades rise up and praise You? Selah.
Shall Your lovingkindness be recounted in the grave, Your faithfulness in Abaddon?
Shall Your wonders be known in the darkness, and Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
But as for me, to You, O LORD, I cry out, and in the morning my prayer comes before You.
Why, O LORD, do You cast off my soul? Why do You hide Your face from me?
Afflicted am I and dying from my youth; I have borne your terrors, I am distraught.
Your burning anger has swept over me; your terrors have cut me off.
They surround me like waters all the day; they compass me about together.
You have put far from me lover and friend; my companions are darkness.
A contemplation of Ethan the Ezrahite.
The lovingkindnesses of the LORD will I sing forever; to generation and generation I will make known Your faithfulness with my mouth.
For I have said, Mercy shall be built up forever; in the heavens you establish your faithfulness.
I have made a covenant with My chosen one; I have sworn to David My servant.
Forever will I establish your seed, and I will build your throne to all generations. Selah.
And the heavens shall praise Your wonders, O LORD, and Your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.
For who in the skies can be compared to the LORD? Who is like the LORD among the sons of the mighty?
God is greatly feared in the council of the holy ones, and awesome above all who are around Him.
O LORD God of hosts, who is mighty like You, O Yah? And Your faithfulness is all around You.
You rule the raging of the sea; when its waves rise, you still them.
You have crushed Rahab like one slain; with the arm of your might you have scattered your enemies.
Yours are the heavens, yours also the earth; the world and its fullness, you have founded them.
The north and the south, you have created them; Tabor and Hermon sing for joy in your name.
Yours is an arm with might; strong is Your hand, exalted is Your right hand.
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne; mercy and truth go before Your face.
Blessed is the people who know the joyful shout; O LORD, they walk in the light of Your face.
In your name they rejoice all the day, and in your righteousness they are exalted.
For you are the glory of their strength, and in your favor our horn is exalted.
For the LORD is our shield, and the Holy One of Israel is our King.
Then you spoke in vision to your holy ones and said, “I have set a help upon a mighty one; I have exalted one chosen from among the people.”
I have found David My servant; with My holy oil I have anointed him.
With whom My hand shall be established; indeed, My arm shall strengthen him.
No enemy shall exact upon him, nor shall the son of wickedness afflict him.
But I will crush his foes before him, and strike down those who hate him.
But My faithfulness and My lovingkindness shall be with him, and in My name his horn shall be exalted.
And I will set his hand in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.
He shall call to Me, “You are my Father, my God, and the Rock of my salvation.”
I also will make him My firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.
Forever I will keep my lovingkindness for him, and my covenant shall stand firm with him.
And I will establish his seed forever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
If his children forsake my law, and do not walk in my judgments,
If they profane My statutes and do not keep My commandments,
Then I will visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.
But I will not withdraw My lovingkindness from him, nor will I be false to My faithfulness.
I will not profane my covenant, nor will I alter the utterance of my lips.
Once have I sworn by My holiness; I will not lie to David.
His seed shall endure forever, and his throne as the sun before Me.
Like the moon it shall be established forever, and the witness in the sky is faithful. Selah.
But you have cast off and rejected; you have been wroth with your anointed.
You have repudiated the covenant of Your servant; You have profaned his crown to the ground.
You have broken down all his walls; you have made his strongholds a ruin.
All who pass along the way have plundered him; he has become a reproach to his neighbors.
You have also exalted the right hand of his adversaries; you have made all his enemies rejoice.
You have also turned back the edge of his sword, and have not made him stand in the battle.
You have brought his splendor to an end and cast his throne down to the ground.
You have shortened the days of his youth; you have wrapped him with shame. Selah.
How long, O LORD, will You hide Yourself forever? Shall Your wrath burn like fire?
Remember how fleeting I am; for what vanity have You created all the children of man?
What man can live and not see death, can deliver his soul from the hand of Sheol? Selah.
Where are Your former lovingkindnesses, O Lord, which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?
Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Your servants; how I bear in my bosom all the many insults of the peoples.
With which Your enemies have reproached, O LORD, with which they have reproached the footsteps of Your anointed.
Blessed be the LORD forever. Amen and Amen.
A prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, you have been our dwelling place in every generation.
Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever you gave birth to the earth and the world, from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.
You turn man back to crushed dust, and say, “Return, children of Adam.”
For a thousand years in your sight are but as yesterday when it passes, and as a watch in the night.
You sweep them away; they are as a sleep. In the morning they are like grass that passes away.
In the morning it flourishes and passes away; in the evening it is cut down and withers.
For we are consumed in Your anger, and in Your wrath we are dismayed.
You have set our iniquities before You, our secret sins in the light of Your countenance.
For all our days pass away in Your wrath; we finish our years like a sigh.
The days of our years are seventy years, and if by strength, eighty years; yet their pride is toil and sorrow, for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.
Who knows the power of Your anger, and Your wrath according to the fear that is due You?
So teach us to number our days, that we may bring a heart of wisdom.
Return, O LORD; how long? And have compassion upon Your servants.
Satisfy us in the morning with your steadfast love, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
Make us glad according to the days you have afflicted us, the years we have seen evil.
Let Your work be revealed to Your servants, and Your splendor upon their children.
And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us; and establish the work of our hands upon us; yes, the work of our hands, establish it.
He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High shall abide in the shadow of the Almighty.
I will say to the LORD, My refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.
For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler, from the deadly pestilence.
He shall cover you with His pinions, and under His wings you shall take refuge; His truth shall be a shield and buckler.
You shall not be afraid of the terror by night, nor of the arrow that flies by day.
Nor of the pestilence that walks in darkness, nor of the destruction that wastes at noonday.
A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand; it shall not come near you.
Only with your eyes shall you look, and you shall behold the recompense of the wicked.
For you, O LORD, are my refuge; you have made the Most High your dwelling place.
No evil shall befall you, nor shall any plague come near your tent.
For he will command his angels concerning you, to guard you in all your ways.
On their hands they shall bear you up, lest you strike your foot against a stone.
You shall tread upon the lion and the cobra; you shall trample the young lion and the serpent.
Because he has set his love upon Me, therefore I will deliver him; I will set him on high, because he has known My name.
He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I am with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.
With long life I will satisfy him, and show him My salvation.
A psalm, a song for the Sabbath day.
It is good to give thanks to the LORD, and to sing praises to Your name, O Most High.
To declare Your lovingkindness in the morning, and Your faithfulness in the nights.
With the ten-stringed instrument and with the harp, with resounding music on the lyre.
For You, O LORD, have made me glad by Your work; I will sing for joy at the works of Your hands.
How great are Your works, O LORD; Your thoughts are very deep.
A brutish man does not know, and a fool does not understand this.
When the wicked spring up like grass, and all the workers of iniquity blossom forth, it is that they may be destroyed forever.
But You, O LORD, are exalted forever.
For behold, Your enemies, O LORD, for behold, Your enemies shall perish; all workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
But You have exalted my horn like that of the wild ox; I am anointed with fresh oil.
My eye has looked upon those who watch for me; of the evildoers who rise up against me, my ears shall hear.
The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree, he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
Planted in the house of the LORD, they shall flourish in the courts of our God.
They shall still bear fruit in old age; they shall be full of sap and fresh and green.
To declare that the LORD is upright; he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
The LORD reigns; He is clothed with majesty. The LORD is clothed; He has girded Himself with strength. Surely the world is established; it shall not be moved.
Your throne is established from of old; from everlasting you are.
The rivers have lifted up, O LORD, the rivers have lifted up their voice; the rivers lift up their pounding waves.
Mightier than the voices of many waters, mightier than the breakers of the sea, mighty on high is the LORD.
Your testimonies are very sure; holiness adorns Your house, O LORD, for length of days.
God of vengeance, O LORD, God of vengeance, shine forth.
Rise up, O Judge of the earth; render recompense upon the proud.
How long shall the wicked, O LORD, how long shall the wicked exult?
They pour forth, they speak arrogance; all the workers of iniquity boast themselves.
They crush Your people, O LORD, and afflict Your inheritance.
They slay the widow and the sojourner, and murder the fatherless.
And they say, “Yah will not see; the God of Jacob will not understand.”
Understand, you brutish among the people; and you fools, when will you be wise?
He who planted the ear, shall he not hear? He who formed the eye, shall he not behold?
He who disciplines the nations, shall He not rebuke? He who teaches man knowledge?
The LORD knows the thoughts of man, that they are but a breath.
Blessed is the man whom You chasten, O LORD, and out of Your law You teach him.
To give him rest from days of trouble, until a pit is dug for the wicked.
For the LORD will not forsake His people, nor will He abandon His inheritance.
For judgment shall return to righteousness, and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul would soon have dwelt in silence.
If I say, “My foot slips,” your mercy, O LORD, upholds me.
In the multitude of my anxious thoughts within me, your consolations delight my soul.
Shall the throne of destruction be joined with you, which fashions mischief by statute?
They band together against the life of the righteous, and condemn innocent blood.
But the LORD has been my high stronghold, and my God the rock of my refuge.
He will bring back upon them their own iniquity, and in their evil He will destroy them; the LORD our God will destroy them.
Oh come, let us sing for joy to the LORD; let us shout aloud to the Rock of our salvation.
Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving; with songs of praise let us shout joyfully to Him.
For the LORD is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
In whose hand are the depths of the earth, and the heights of the mountains are his.
The sea is his, and he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
Oh come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the LORD our Maker.
For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. Today, if you will hear his voice.
Do not harden your hearts, as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah in the wilderness.
Where your fathers tested Me, they tried Me, though they had seen My work.
Forty years I loathed that generation, and I said, “They are a people who go astray in their heart, and they have not known My ways.”
So I swore in My wrath, “They shall not enter into My rest.”
Sing to the LORD a new song; sing to the LORD, all the earth.
Sing to the LORD, bless His name; proclaim His salvation from day to day.
Declare his glory among the nations, his wondrous works among all the peoples.
For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; he is to be feared above all gods.
For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
Honor and majesty are before Him; strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name; bring an offering, and come into His courts.
Bow yourselves before the LORD in the splendor of holiness; tremble before Him, all the earth.
Say among the nations, “The LORD reigns; indeed, the world is established, it shall not be moved; he will judge the peoples with equity.”
Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea roar, and all its fullness.
Let the field exult, and all that is in it; then shall all the trees of the forest sing for joy.
Before the LORD, for He comes, for He comes to judge the earth; He will judge the world in righteousness, and the peoples in His faithfulness.
The LORD reigns; let the earth rejoice; let the many coastlands be glad.
Cloud and thick darkness are round about Him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
Fire goes before Him, and burns up His adversaries round about.
His lightnings lit up the world; the earth saw and trembled.
The mountains melt like wax before the LORD, before the Lord of all the earth.
The heavens proclaim His righteousness, and all the peoples behold His glory.
All who serve a carved image shall be put to shame, those who boast themselves in idols; worship Him, all you gods.
Zion has heard and is glad, and the daughters of Judah rejoice, because of Your judgments, O LORD.
For you, O LORD, are Most High over all the earth; you are greatly exalted above all gods.
O you who love the LORD, hate evil; he preserves the souls of his faithful ones, from the hand of the wicked he delivers them.
Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.
Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous, and give thanks to the remembrance of His holiness.
Sing to the LORD a new song, for He has done wonders; His right hand and His holy arm have worked salvation for Him.
The LORD has made known His salvation; in the sight of the nations He has revealed His righteousness.
He has remembered His mercy and His faithfulness to the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
Make a joyful shout to the LORD, all the earth; break forth, sing aloud, and make melody.
Sing praises to the LORD with the harp, with the harp and the voice of melody.
With trumpets and the sound of the horn, shout before the King, the LORD.
Let the sea roar, and all its fullness; the world, and those who dwell in it.
Let the rivers clap their hands; let the mountains sing for joy together.
Before the LORD, for He comes to judge the earth; He will judge the world in righteousness, and the peoples with equity.
The LORD reigns; let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned upon the cherubim; let the earth shake.
The LORD is great in Zion, and He is exalted above all the peoples.
Let them praise Your great and awesome name; holy is He.
And the strength of the King loves justice; you have established equity; justice and righteousness in Jacob you have performed.
Exalt the LORD our God, and bow yourselves at His footstool, for He is holy.
Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among those who call upon his name; they call upon the LORD, and he answers them.
In the pillar of cloud He spoke to them; they kept His testimonies, and the statute that He gave them.
O LORD our God, You answered them; You were a forgiving God to them, yet an avenger of their deeds.
Exalt the LORD our God, and bow yourselves at His holy mountain, for holy is the LORD our God.
A psalm for thanksgiving. Make a joyful shout to the LORD, all the earth.
Serve the LORD with gladness; come before His presence with singing.
Know that the LORD, He is God; it is He who has made us, and we are His, His people and the sheep of His pasture.
Enter his gates with thanksgiving, and his courts with praise; give thanks to him, bless his name.
For the LORD is good; his mercy endures forever, and his faithfulness to all generations.
A Psalm of David. I will sing of mercy and judgment; to You, O LORD, I will sing praises.
I will act wisely in the way of integrity; oh when will you come to me? I will walk within my house with a blameless heart.
I will set no worthless thing before my eyes; I hate the work of those who turn aside, it shall not cling to me.
A perverse heart shall depart from me; evil will I not know.
Whoever slanders his neighbor in secret, him will I cut off; the one with haughty eyes and a proud heart, him I will not endure.
My eyes are upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he who walks in the way of integrity, he it is who shall minister to me.
He who practices deceit shall not dwell within my house; he who speaks lies shall not stand before my eyes.
Morning by morning I will destroy all the wicked of the land, to cut off from the city of the LORD all who work iniquity.
A prayer of the afflicted, when he is faint and pours out his complaint before the LORD.
O LORD, hear my prayer, and let my cry for help come to You.
Do not hide Your face from me in the day of my distress; incline Your ear to me; in the day when I call, answer me speedily.
For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are scorched like a hearth.
My heart is stricken and withered like grass, for I forget to eat my bread.
Because of the sound of my groaning, my bone clings to my flesh.
I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I have become as an owl of the desolate ruins.
I lie awake and am as a lonely bird upon the housetop.
All the day my enemies reproach me; those who rage against me have sworn by me.
For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping.
Because of your indignation and your wrath, for you have lifted me up and cast me away.
My days are like a lengthened shadow, and I wither like grass.
But you, O LORD, sit enthroned forever, and the remembrance of you endures to all generations.
You will arise and have mercy upon Zion, for it is time to show favor to her; indeed, the appointed season has come.
For Your servants take pleasure in her stones, and show favor to her dust.
So the nations shall fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth Your glory.
For the LORD has built up Zion; he has appeared in his glory.
He has turned to the prayer of the destitute, and has not despised their prayer.
Let this be written for a generation to come, and a people yet to be created shall praise the LORD.
For he has looked down from the height of his holiness; from heaven the LORD has gazed upon the earth.
To hear the groaning of the prisoner, to loose those appointed to death.
To declare in Zion the name of the LORD, and His praise in Jerusalem.
When the peoples are gathered together, and the kingdoms also, to serve the LORD.
He has afflicted my strength in the way; He has shortened my days.
I say, O my God, do not take me away in the midst of my days; your years are through all generations.
Of old you laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.
They shall perish, but you remain; and all of them shall wear out like a garment. Like clothing you will change them, and they shall be changed.
But you are the same, and your years shall have no end.
The children of Your servants shall dwell secure, and their seed shall be established before You.
Of David. Bless the LORD, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless His holy name.
Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all His benefits.
Who forgives all your iniquities, who heals all your diseases.
Who redeems my life from the pit, who crowns me with lovingkindness and tender mercies.
Who satisfies your adornment with good things; your youth is renewed like the eagle.
The LORD performs righteousness and judgments for all who are oppressed.
He made known His ways to Moses, His deeds to the children of Israel.
The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love.
He will not contend forever, nor will He keep His anger for all eternity.
He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor repaid us according to our iniquities.
For as the height of the heavens above the earth, so mighty is His steadfast love over those who fear Him.
As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.
As a father has compassion on his children, so the LORD has compassion on those who fear Him.
For He Himself knows our frame; He remembers that we are dust.
A mortal, like grass are his days; like the flower of the field, so he flourishes.
